Peercoin is a proof-of-stake cryptocurrency launched in August 2012. Like Bitcoin, Peercoin stores value and can be sent over the internet without a central authority. However, unlike Bitcoin, it does not require copious amounts of energy to stay secure. Peercoin is highly energy efficient, and transactions can be validated on hardware akin to Raspberry Pi of the first generation. Owning Peercoins allows participation in the proof-of-stake consensus, making it possible to create new blocks and be rewarded.
